line_1: There in the Hall they both regale
line_2: With generous Wine and Nappy Ale,

line_1: " And with their amorous spoils thy greedy eyes regale! "
line_2: "Where Nymphs of Paradise their charms reveal,

line_1: Ambrosial scents the ravish'd smell regale;
line_2: Such as Arabia's spicy groves exhale,
To hunt the pig with slippery tail!)

line_1: The drop, that will the heart regale,
line_2: The happy breeze that swells the sail,

line_1: Or honey'd Cakes, which Gods themselves regale,
line_2: In vain the Cheeses, Offspring of the Pale,

line_1: For a Boyle, and a Swift, will each other regale.
line_2: The Bus'ness is done, if with him you prevail;

line_1: Content his own sharp stomach to regale
line_2: With plain, substantial roast-meat and mild ale.

line_1: Which sense and fancy too regale,
line_2: With op'ning views of hill and dale,

line_1: While Meriden offers no humble regale;
line_2: When I left the vile town, 'gainst which ever I'll rail,

line_1: Their breath a sample of last night's regale,
line_2: Now flush'd with drunk'ness, now with whoredom pale,

line_1: And with their own substantial feast regale.
line_2: Whom Wisdom tutors, whom the Virtues hail,
